title: Whenever Caitlyn finishes her Phantom Dancer.

replies.body: Isn't that girl like 14?

Her age was never confirmed, but even if she is 14 at first, the second arc happens 7 years later, which makes her 21 by then.

either way, why do you ask? xD

> [{quoted}](name=RaptorKarr,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=3nE03Etf,comment-id=00000000000000010000,timestamp=2015-10-29T00:44:58.830+0000)

To be fair, America is on its entirely own plane of immaturity when it comes to sexuality.

And Japan's so sexually repressed that the only way to keep its population up is to make sure that whoever will bone will do it as soon as possible.

https://media.giphy.com/media/k9XrZaAJuQyMU/giphy.gif

> [{quoted}](name=For Carthage,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=3nE03Etf,comment-id=0000000000000001000000010000,timestamp=2015-10-29T19:07:19.071+0000)
>
> And Japan's so sexually repressed that the only way to keep its population up is to make sure that whoever will bone will do it as soon as possible.
> 
> https://media.giphy.com/media/k9XrZaAJuQyMU/giphy.gif

Considering their recently dwindling population, that actually isn't too farfetched.  Calling them "repressed" is a stretch, inasmuch as minding their own fucking  business.

I had to do a paper on Japanese media culture and the causes of many of their tendencies.  The reason anime is so flashy, exaggerated, and non-nonsensical is because they as a people prefer things that run directly perpendicular to their culture.

So how you see what's-her-face dress in this cartoon - or even how she acts - is so far gone from what any Japanese woman would act like that if you actually tried any of it in Japan you'd probably be more likely to get belted sooner than you'd make friends.  Escapism is obnoxious like that.

And they are incredibly repressed.  I think it's up to like 25% of men and some-odd 40% of women or so find sex repulsive in Japan.  That's not a sign of "minding their own business".
i googled it, he/she is not. T_T

age of consent is 16 in canada too

Underage is a very stupid concept in this kind of context (although I despise any kind of sexy in media), since there's no magical date where you become a responsible and autonomous adult. We should focus more on ACTUAL violence towards children rather than going "ZOMG ZOMG A 18 Y.O. CAN'T GO WITH A 16 Y.O. BECAUSE MY GRAND GRAND GRANDPA MADE A LAW THAT SAYS IT".
Doubt she was a school teacher at 21 tough.

Doubt comparing our society's standards with a world's formerly governed by a fascist omnipotent dictator in a fictional universe made up of drawn papers to create animation from a studio in the country of Japan *gasp* makes any fucking sense.

Are we argueing if a piece of drawn paper is underaged or not?

LOL WUT
I remember the creators stating that since the villages are all underground, they all have different calendars.  Yoko is 18 at the start of the show.
